that 11mbit is connection-speed rating, not what you're actually pushing through with network data. encryption/authentication should not affect that number. if you're not running at the connection-speed rating that you expect, its most likely a signal strength/orientation or interfeerance issue
winXP lies, 16mbit is not a valid connection rating afaik
next valid rating after 11 is 54 I believe
oh, you are getting 1mbit? I thought you said you had 11
are you talking aobut 16m of file transfer rate between wired PC's within your lan?
bt not going to work as well over wifi, and in general is an instable benchmark for testing network speed
bt has too many simultaneous connections for wifi to perform as well as wired
I would use internal-testing to benchmark your wifi's capabilities
check kismet for any interfeering channels or devices
set your AP to use _only_ the highest speed revision that your hardware supports (G or N Only, for example)
test with WPA disabled and verify that you can connect with G-only mode or b-only, whatever you support at a max
if you can't achieve that connectevity, I'd re-verify that you're using the most-capable driver in ubuntu
most _capable_ ;)
youd have to findout what driver is compatible, then install the newest version
I can help you later with wifi-specifics if you want to look me up in #fluxbuntu
